projectPurpose: To provide a lightweight, easy-to-set-up, and easy-to-manage LDAP server specifically designed for authentication, primarily targeting self-hosting environments and integration with open-source applications that support LDAP for external authentication, simplifying the process compared to traditional LDAP servers.
mainFeatures: User-friendly web UI for user management
Supports SQLite, MySQL/MariaDB, or PostgreSQL backends
Simple to set up and manage

alternatives.name: FreeIPA
mainFeatures: Integrated identity management (LDAP, Kerberos, DNS, CA)

alternatives.name: Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS)
mainFeatures: Centralized user, computer, and resource management

alternatives.name: Microsoft Entra ID
mainFeatures: Integrates with Azure and third-party apps
Can synchronize with on-prem AD DS

mostWellKnownAlternative: Microsoft Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS)
marketPositioning: LLDAP positions itself as a simple, lightweight, and user-friendly LDAP authentication server for self-hosted and small-scale deployments. It prioritizes ease of use and minimal resource requirements over the comprehensive feature sets found in traditional, enterprise-grade LDAP servers like OpenLDAP or 389 Directory Server, or full identity management solutions like FreeIPA. Its target audience includes users and small organizations needing a straightforward way to add LDAP authentication to open-source applications without the complexity of larger directory services.
